textRun.content: 1.1 – Introduction to Characters and Artifact

Lars, our dragon pilot and main character is riding a dragon ship full of passengers. He’s sitting down on the head of the dragon and peering towards the horizon as the ship nears the destination. He has an uptight posture with a serious expression but his fox tail is swinging side to side from excitement.
Lars (in his head):
Discere, cogitare, agere
- the triad of wisdom. Learning enriches the mind, and thinking sharpens it, but it is through action that we truly manifest our knowledge and shape our reality.
Lars (in his head): You would think that a merchant guild wouldn’t bother creating such a philosophical motto and instead advertise 1+1 dragon ship seats every holiday season.
Lars (in his head): We could even offer complementary earth meals from the reincarnated human chefs who arrived to the realm of Zephyr.
Lars (in his head):  But then again, we wouldn’t be embarking on artifact hunts and treasure expeditions if our guild’s only purpose was commerce.

Claude, the rich merchant and our first love interest enters the scene. He is sitting down on the dragons back and leaning on one of her back spikes. He has a relaxed demeanor as if he’s half asleep but still smiling brightly as he calls for the captain’s attention. Though, there isn’t any other passenger to feel bothered by him anyway. Their recent mission was specific to guild embers only.
Unknown: Our dearest Captain Lars! are you mumbling to yourself again?

Lars’s ears are perked up from the loud voice and he tries to maintain a serious posture. However, his tail frails around even more and he’s soon resigned to facing Claude so as to hide his excited tail.
Unknown: Or are you whispering trade-secret shortcuts to your, or more so,
MY
lovely dragon, Spotsy?
Lars: Bad at naming as always, Sir Claude. Especially for this fine species of polka dot ruby fireblazer.
Cue rambling from Lars as his eyes light up, not for Claude’s teasing but more so because of how he’s going to go on a spree talking about his new ship as a dragon fanatic.

Lars: Look at how these scales are gleaming with a crimson hue! Did you know that as she breathes, the intense heat generated caused by her metabolism can cause the air pockets under her scales to shimmer and expand? These ruby reminiscent distortions aren’t for mere show either, Guild master Sylvian mentioned that certain blacksmiths can use the ensuing heat for their forging practices. I studied a lot about this since Rory mentioned she wanted to help out her family, and you know how she can be as stubborn as a mule. Well, she’s technically a bull descendent so that’s beside the point but-
Claude: Focus on your dragon steering Captain! I wouldn’t want to be that poor passenger who reincarnates early to the Earth realm just because you were adoring our newest ship.
Claude: I did make quite an effort to negotiate for her, after all.
Claude: But this wouldn’t be the first dragon ship I’ve acquired. I need a new challenge after the last one...
Lars: Shhh Sir Claude! You’re going to hurt Spotsy’s feelings. Not to mention, she’ll get confused and make a false move if you don’t stop bothering me.
Lars: The tabloids would have a field day if you were to fall off.
Lars: But more importantly, Guild master Sylvian would be quite upset if our guild got noticed only for your publicity stunt.
Claude: Tsk, tsk, Captain, you should know that a few gossiping papers doesn’t make any difference for me.
Claude: Not because all publicity is good publicity, that’s just a standard industry cliché.
Claude: It’s because I only ever seek to be the greatest merchant there is and I will use every tool at my disposal to achieve it.

Lars: Really? I didn’t know our young master liked being at the center of attention. You always seem to be hiding that you’re the only heir of the infamous Dupont merchant family. At first, I thought it was so there wouldn’t be any rumors of our Guild being associated with your family name, but you’ve always been acting suspiciously about it. You never seem to give out your last name during our expeditions or client meetings and come to think of it your gala partner at the scale ball, did mention that you were using a disguise spell-
Claude: Captain, I didn’t think that you were interested in my personal life all that much.
Claude: I could satisfy your curiosity by merely saying that I enjoy the challenge of making my own name…
Claude: …but then you’ll have to satisfy my curious question as well, which would be the reason behind your wagging tail that you’re so cutely trying to hide-

Lars instantly starts to feel himself heating up and takes hold of his tail to calm it down, Claude’s teasing did always get the best of him though he tried his best o maintain his composure as the captain. His ears drooped as he tried to look away from embarrassment but he wouldn’t let him have the last word. The least he could do would be to quickly distract him.
Lars: THEN I SUPPOSE you’d have no problem if the headlines were to go like this-

Lars: ‘The rising star, Claude from the infamous Dupont merchant family, tragically plummets to his death as a result of angering the fireblazer dragon ship captain. The tragic mistake of paying 250 thousand gold coins for a chance to reach the skies, only to plummet to the bottom of the sea and become a gourmet meal.’
Claude: Haha, my dear captain, are you planning to bankrupt the entire realm with those numbers?
Claude: Or did you hear them from your human passengers again?
Claude: I’ve missed talking with them, but the recent seasonal galas are filling up my timetable.
Claude: Not to mention our recent artifact negotiations. Who knew a single necklace would end up causing me to bicker with the seller so much.
Claude: You’d think he dug it up from his family grave with the way he clung to it even though it was just a random artifact that appeared out of thin air.
Claude: Besides, captain, you should know better than to recklessly use the Dupont last name.
Claude: I prefer it when you say my name after all. It’s one of the tiny joys of my life.

The sudden confession surprises Lars and even though it wasn’t the first time that he had heard Claude making such comments, he was nonetheless surprised when they were aimed at him. His fur stands on edge and he finds himself waving his arms around aimlessly as he tries to make sense of his words.
Lars: W-w-what are you saying all of a sudden?! Did you lose your mind?
Lars: If you tease me again, I really won’t be able to guarantee your safety…
Lars: …so, s-stop it.
Claude: Awe, is our captain getting shy all of a sudden? Did you know your ears get red when your embarrassed?

Lars quickly pulls away his hands from the dragon ships head and puts them on his head. You would think that with his age he wouldn’t be so gullible to fall for someone’s word, but he still had a child-like affliction when it came to Claude and how he tried to compete for his attention.
Lars: You just keep spouting lies; I should know better than to trust your lizard tongue.
Claude pays Lars’s embarrassment no mind and continues on unbothered.
Claude: You know, if we ever crash, we could go down the reincarnation route together.
Claude: I wouldn’t mind starting over as long as there’s something new to conquer. We would make quite the adventurous pair as well.

Claude suddenly takes a more serious expression and though he still has a smile on his face, his eyes venture far away as if he’s too lost in thought to actually weigh the meaning behind his words. But soon enough he returns to his usual carefree self, his charismatic side does tend to turn dark every once in while in the presence of his favored guild members but he never spends too much time delving on it.
Claude: Life gets pretty boring when you have everything you need in the palm of your hand.
Lars: Wait, does that have something to do with your family-
Claude: You know Captain-

Claude: Our mansions scholar, the Archmage of Zephyr, used to tell me that the upper echelon of humans on earth fly in the skies by genetically mutated wings, you could say it’s similar to what Boss Sylvian has. They can even turn their pets to humans while maintaining their innate animal traits such as ears, tails and more.
Claude: In fact, you could be similar to one of their domesticated fox breeds and-

Claude was indeed masterful at steering away the topic of conversation, more so than Lars ever could. That was quite evident since Lars had already forgotten his string of thought and his eyes shined brightly as his ears perked up to hear more of what Claude had to say. Not even wasting a single breath before jumping straight into questioning Claude.

Lars: You’re lying! How on earth did they do that? You’re not teasing me like last time, are you? Like how you mentioned that a couple reincarnated together. Because I did ask Sylvian and he swore that the only mention similar to your story was if two reincarnations happened at the same time
and even then,

they could end up in a nearby location, but not next to each other. I didn’t hear any of the passengers talk about it either! Come to think of it, Rory did mention some people casting their lover’s dead soul into puppets and releasing them when their partner dies to match the timing, but I thought that was just a children’s tale-

Just like that, he had gone on another spree of spouting words without any regard for his conversation partner. Those around him suspected that this trait of his developed due to how much he one-sidedly spoke to the dragons under his care. But no one wanted dampen his excitement and break his trace of sentences. He was indeed cared for in this unique and bizarre way by those around him.
Claude: As much as I hate to cut you off your cute rambling captain, I think we’ll have to save our conversation for later.
Claude: Our dearest guild master’s staff is lighting our landing spot. You’ll be blinded by the number of sunflowers and roses he set up.
Claude: His idea of guiding us with flowers colors is as gentle as always.
Oblivious to Lars who is already steering the dragon towards the destination, Claude starts to mumble to himself. His words will be carried by the wind yet they’ll always stay close his heart.
Claude: Yet, it’s frightening when you think of the power he’s hiding in those roots and stalks…
Lars: Ah, it’s a shame. I was hoping to learn something new. We reached home way earlier than I expected as always. I have to reward Spotsy well when we get back.
Claude: I’d be inclined to say that you didn’t manage to tap into our dragon’s full potential captain. Owning up to how I stole your attention for more than half,
or better yet
, the entire ride.
Lars: Ugh, I should have pushed you off the dragon’s back myself-
Claude: However, since you managed to get us here without any
dangerous maneuvers
, I’ll allow you to be the first to touch our newest artifact.
Claude: It’s the first time it’s made its way to our side of the realm, making the occasion quite momentous, wouldn’t you say?

As our two guild members land in the destined area, a tall and thinly magician starts to walk towards them. His name is Sylvian and he is the second male interest of our story. As the guild master, he is the first person to welcome the two back. He nods in the direction of Claude and gives a smile to our main character, Lars. His black wings flutter as he whispers his spell and soon enough sunflowers and roses bloom from his staff. Through another quick motion, he presents them to our companions but more so urging Lars to take it with his strong and kind gaze.
Unknown: In a sky where dragons soar with grace, a guild of merchants finds its place. With sunflowers and roses in their hands, they guide passengers to enchanted lands.
Unknown: Welcome back, dear members of “Custodes Sylvae”. I’m happy to see that you both landed safely.
Unknown: Lars, your piloting was truly magnificent as always. It’s a sight that I’m honored to witness every time.

Claude: It wouldn’t be a warm welcome if Master Sylvian weren’t here to recite his poetry. I missed having someone challenging to tease, Captain Lars over here is too gullible and makes it child play for me HAHAHA!

As Claude boisterously laughed at his own joke, Lars’s ears drooped slightly though he was quick to hide them this time. He didn’t like being resembled to a child especially by someone whose intellect and charisma he admired.
Lars: Thank you, Master. I wish you could have joined us on the ride too. Sir Claude here almost caused us to plummet to our doom... twice.
Claude: Eh, I did promise to reward you later, didn’t I? drum roll please ~ Behold!-
Claude: Ah, but wait, I seem to have left it on the ship.
Claude: Captain, could you be so kind as to bring our precious cargo?

As Lars hurried back to the ship to bring the prized artifact, Claude and Sylvian began to await his return while making a bit of small talk. Soon, another member of the guild would be joining them too.
Sylvian: Claude, remember what I said about teasing him too much? Besides, if Rory catches you giving Lars trouble again...
Rory: Clauuudy~
Claude: Roryyy~
Rory: I believe I mentioned that if I ever catch you bossing Larsy around, I’d pluck out your lizard eyes to adorn my newest puppet, Agatha.
Rory: You should know that my threats work quite effectively, especially with how Brittina’s puppet dress is shimmering with the scales you’ve kindly donated... in your sleep, of course.

Our newest character had stepped out from behind Sylvian, true to her nature as a bull descendent, Rory was quick to charge at those who annoyed her. Her relationship with Claude had been rocky with the start but it never did manage to get better owning up to Claude’s flirtatious nature. You could say that they tolerated each other for the sake of the other members.
Claude: If it isn’t our hot-tempered bull, breathing fire as soon as she lays eyes on me. It’s a pleasure to see you again, little Rory. Or should I say, a curse to behold?
Rory: Hoy! I told you never to call me that again! And doesn’t your receding hairline remind you that half your hair now belongs to Puppet Alex because you called me a midget last time?!
Claude: Now, now, I would have to say these finely braided silver strands that I’ve so
kindly donated
to you are what’s bringing half the revenue for your puppet shows, aren’t they little Rory?
Rory: I warned you not to call me that, you cheap lizard!
Rory: You really have the gall to be talking to me when all your travel funds are conveniently collected from my shows.
Rory: For the sake of compensation, it’s time to say goodbye to Claude Junior with my nifty scissor too-
Before their conflict of words start colliding in the physical realm as well Lars swiftly returns with a big ornate box in hand.
Lars: I’m back with the cargo!
Rory: Larsy, you’re back! Awe, I missed you so much. One more minute with my arch-nemesis over here and his rag-like face would be honored by my vomit.
Lars: Come on Rory, you don’t really mean that.
Rory: I have never meant anything more in all my bull years.
Claude: That explains why you’re such a bullshitting-
Lars: AHEM! Sir Claude, why don’t you help me out with carrying this box? It’s quite heavy for me to carry.
Sylvian: Are you feeling okay? Do you need me to cast a relief spell for you?

Instantly, Sylvian uses his staff and mumbles a spell to make the artifact box hover in midair. Lars feels himself sigh from relief, yet a bit embarrassed that his lie to break up the conflict made him look too weak for a single ornate box.
Sylvian: Carrying such heavy things might affect your health after all. That was one of the main things my academic years taught me aside from all the other …
unique experiences
Lars felt obliged to correct the misunderstanding at all costs.

Lars: It’s okay master, I needed to get in my daily dose of exercise too. I don’t want you to think that I’m too weak for one box! I just wanted to make Claude too busy to argue with Rory. You know how I’ve spoilt Rory; I can’t talk back to her in these kinds of situations. More than that, what would our passengers think if their pilot wasn’t able to pick up a heavily gold-adorned box from their dragon’s second cargo-specific stomach and not run around its spiky back, over the landing port, to deliver the artifact? Would they think it’s animal abuse because the dragon isn’t using its second stomach for food? What if they think we’re slaving them away?! My parents wouldn’t let me live this down if they ever heard such rumors. But they don’t use their second stomach for food anyways; it’s mostly for material to build their nests-
Sylvian: Lars, I understand. Now, let’s use that breathing technique that the humans thought us last time. You remember? Breathe for 3 seconds, hold it for 6, and then release it for 9 seconds.

Lars obediently follows his master’s instructions and sees his breathing slowing down to some extent. Before he could repeat another set of ramblings, Sylvian steps in as the kind mentor he always is.
Sylvian: No one is going to think those things of you, Lars.

Sylvian: In every whispered phrase, a friendship blooms. You who cherish your dragon’s well-being, dispelling any gloom. For their safety, you would give your all. A protector, a guardian, answering their call.
Sylvian: If I were a dragon, I wouldn’t want any other handler than you to take care of me.
Claude: SOOO, what I gather is that Master Sylvian wants to have Lars ride him-
Rory: SHUT UP! You wouldn’t dream of understanding my mentor’s cherished feelings for Larsy.
Rory: Even if he did like Lars that way, it’s not as if he would wait years in an unrequited crush just to waste away his life singing little poetry praises and blooming flower out of thin air.

One would think that Sylvian’s secret was out and his love story shared for all to hear. Yet, none could believe that such a gentle guild master would be able to reverently love another for many years, as was the case. No one knew why but they could point to how the guild master’s indiscriminative kindness may have led to the loss of his singular love. In the face of the admiration he received, he could never find the only adoration he craved. The love of one person, who was his junior Lars.
Rory: Honestly, I don’t even know what Lars sees in you that makes him admire-

Seemed like another unrequited love story was in the happenings. Lars had already gotten past his verbal breakdown. His master had a way with words though not quite in the way Claude had. Each had their unique methods of calming Lars down though one was more of a redirection than proper fixation.
Lars: AHHHHHHH- STOP RORY! HOLD ON!
Lars: NEVER GONNA GIVE YOU UP, NEVER GONNA LET YOU DOWN. NEVER GONNA RUN AROUND AND DESERT YOU.

Claude: As much as I like it when you sing those human songs captain, I think we’re better off witnessing the artifact before the evening sets and little Rory decides to defile my innocent body with her tools.
Claude: I can see fumes exiting her head as we speak. Oh! ************* I think they got even bigger.
Sylvian: Alright everyone, settle down.
Sylvian: Let me cast a safety spell over the box first, you can never be sure if there are any hidden traps inside
After a few seconds of sparking light and no noteworthy reactions…
Sylvian: No traps or enchantments detected. It seems we’re in the clear. Let’s unveil the treasure within.

Sylvian opens the box to reveal a long necklace with a multitude of thick bands and chains resting in a plush cloth. However, the most striking item on the necklace would be the red gem in the middle. The guild members found themselves drawn so much to the ruby hue that they forgot to notice the engravings on the sides of the chains. An ancient language from the time of the original descendants.
Claude: Before anyone starts their inspection, I promised our dear captain he’d be the first person to hold it.
Claude casually pushes the box towards Lars and beckons him to pick up the artifact.
Lars: Thanks, Sir Claude. Wow! Look at the detailing on this artifact. It’s truly a work of art.
Claude: Indeed, it’s a testament to the skill and craftsmanship of the ancient civilization that created it. If they even created it, since we have no idea about its origins yet.
Claude: Not to mention, I could never let go of such a mysterious prize, I need to uncover its secrets all for myself…

Claude’s expression turned from one of curiosity and mirth to that of pure obsession as he peered towards the artifact. He always had a penchant towards challenges and trials. Tough, he never properly explained his obsession with them, his eyes would light up in strange eyes whenever such an event presented itself.
Claude: …Ahem, with the help of our prestigious scholar as well of course!
Claude: Boss Sylvian, you have quite the reputation in the academic world for discovering the connection between our realm and Earth. Especially the cycle of reincarnations connecting the two.
Claude: If someone were to discover the potential behind this artifact, it would be none other than you.
Rory: Ugh, quit trying to suck up and get close to my Mentor with your scale-rotten face.
Claude: Weren’t these the very same scales you took for your dolls?
Claude: I was under the impression that they even made you gain a great show last time with your puppets.
Claude: Hmm, what was it called again? Boring-ina? Boorish-ina? Banal-ina? -
Rory: It was BRITTINA, you dagger-mouthed, scale-brained, bark-bellied, algae-breathing gullet on legs-
Claude: I’d lower myself to your idiotic level, but then you’d beat me with experience-
Sylvian: Both of you, it’s time to stop.

Sylvian’s booming voice instantly quieted everyone down. Even now, he had to yet to be mad but he did occasionally use such an authoritive voice to calm those around him. It seemed contrary to his rather calm and collected nature even though they were in the same vein of characteristics.
Sylvian: Let us embrace empathy’s grace and refrain from jesting, for each soul carries its own unique beauty. Whether it be lizards, foxes, swans, or bulls.
Rory: Sorry, Mentor.
Looks like I’ve overstepped a bit.
Claude: It’s never a good move to annoy your benefactor. Apologies, Boss.
As Claude and Rory move away to not bump head again, Lars quietly moves towards Sylvian and whispers in a quiet tone.
Lars: Thanks for easing off the tension, Master Sylvian. I’ve spoiled Rory too much, and it gets out of hand when they start bickering.
Sylvian: No problem at all, Lars. I might not understand your relationship with Rory well as you both are best friends from a young age. But I would hate to see a rift between us as guild members.
Sylvian: Your bond with Rory holds a treasure untold. A childhood’s embrace worth more than gold. I wish I could have that kind of friendship too-
Lars: What are you talking about, Master?
Lars: Are you saying we aren’t friends?
Sylvian: … it’s just that-

Lars: You know, even if I’m just a coworker to you. You’re my cherished friend, though I value you first and foremost as the boss, I still enjoy how you’re kind to everyone, share your poetry with them and give them gifts.

Lars: Sorry if that sounds like I’m sucking up to you or asking you for something, which I’m not in any way! It’s just that my mom always told me to be straightforward when taming wild dragon species, especially the ones with thorns on their lateral muscles. Their venom comes from there, and it really hurts when they start dangling your legs off the side, which even caused me to have a scar on this part of my right leg, and-
Sylvian: Hahahaha!
Sylvian: Ah, the joy you bring to my life Lars, what would I do without you to brighten up my day.
Sylvian: Don’t worry about it, it’s just that It's hard to bring out the words that bubble up in your throat sometimes.
Sylvian: But I do appreciate your efforts, I just hope that I can be the recipient of your more
endearing
efforts as well.
Lars: Uhm, what do you mean, Mast-
Rory: Larsy, Larsy, hear me out here!
Rory: Don’t you think Claude resembles a pizza? I’m contemplating which food he is so I can effortlessly consume him when his guard is down. I have the appetite of a bull after all.
Claude: People would think you’re actually admiring how widely loved and delicious I am.
Rory: His hair is the white mozzarella cheese, and his two saucepan-wide lizard eyes are two ungodly pineapple slices covering the entire pizza. A sacrilege to all meals in the universe combined.
Rory: Let’s see what else... He’s the fast-food type of cheap pizza too, the one where they use dragon blaze instead of organic fires.
Rory: In fact, his whole act is cheap, constantly trying to win people over acting like everything’s a challenge.
Sylvian: Rory, my dear apprentice, I think you’re getting a bit distracted yourself. How about we-
Rory: You keep wanting to pour some nice red over him... ketchup obviously.
Rory: The type where you think there’s no cheese on it, well, it’s OBVIOUSLY UNDER THE SAUCE.
Claude: As a lizard descendant, your comment is hurting me, little Rory.
Sylvian: Now, Claude, you should know better than to keep teasing those—
Rory: Hoho, keep saying “little,” and I’ll show you how many slices of you are left once I’m done with you. You’re going to regret it so badly that you’ll keep shouting, “IT’S ENOUGH SLICES!”
Sylvian: EVERYONE! Steadfast now.
Sylvian: We have to get back to business and let our minds take some proper rest. We need to give a break to our dragon as well.
Lars: You’re right, boss. Sorry for the trouble.

As the environment calms down through Sylvian’s kind yet strict order, he takes the artifact and observes it. As someone who was going to research the history and potential of such a mysterious item, he needed to focus all his diverted attention for maximal results.
Sylvian: I’d like to observe this a bit more in my lab.
Sylvian: A curious trinket, its secrets untold. An odd accessory with immense power. To shape time’s fragments, to weave its essence.

Sylvian: It eerily resembles an artifact that I had previously seen in the academic domain. A one-of-a-kind gemstone brooch belonging to a family of dragons with our very own half-human, half-animal traits as descendants.
Sylvian: I haven’t heard of them in quite some time, and though the color of this brooches’ gem contrasts the descriptions I’ve heard and read, it’s something worth researching.
Sylvian: Speaking of which, how much did you exchange for it, Claude? We need to see if the funds from Rory’s recent puppet show will be able to cover the costs.
Claude: Well, a merchant may only exchange for what they’re willing to offer.
Claude: However, the infamous Claude can overcome any trial as long as he wishes for it.
Claude: Ah, the misery of knowing the world will fit into the palm of my hand as long as I aim for it.
Rory: Ernest Jones called and said he wants his god complex back, or better yet-
Rory: Ovid left a voicemail saying he’s issuing the world a mental refund for the amount of narcissism you’re breathing into the world.
Sylvian: You didn’t quite answer my question-
Rory: Come to think about it mentor, can I take this artifact for a spin before you put it in your lab?
Rory: This design is perfect for one of my dolls. I can create a new puppet based on these intricate patterns and symbols. It will be a showstopper!
Sylvian: If you feel inspired by this artifact, then by all means, go ahead.
Lars: That’s a great idea! We could even visit your puppet show stall and see what magic you will create. It’s been some time since I last played with the kids as well.

As our 4 guild members make their way towards the open area with the numerous stalls. Sylvian slows down his steps to watch over the others as they move ahead. Claude and Rory walked with quicker steps ahead to see who could reach the stall faster, their bickering was nothing to hold back on either. Rory was pulling Lars’s hand as well as they all walked side-by-side to their destination. Quietly, the guild master smiled to himself.
1.2 – The Puppet Show and First Time Freeze
Soon enough, our cast arrived to the puppet show stall that Ruby had prepared. You could see her various puppets being displayed on the standstill.
Rory: As you can see here, we have my special dolls who actually have a purpose in life other than creating air pollution with their voice like a
certain someone
Rory: Not to mention, Brittina and Alex were very
happy, enthusiastic, and even enthralled
to enhance their looks with the help of Claudy over here.
You could basically feel sarcasm dripping from her words, if not obvious enough.
Rory: I did want to pluck out the lying lizard’s eyes for Agatha, but it’s very hard to do that in his sleep especially since he’s such a light sleeper.
Claude: So, you’ve been watching over me in my sleep? Naughty little Rory.
Rory: Somewhere in Zephyr, a tree is tirelessly producing oxygen for you. I think you owe it an apology because of all the air pollution you’re creating with that mouth.
Claude: I could excuse the scale stealing incident and the hair cutting fiasco because I’m so benevolent.
Claude: However, night peeking is a no-no. Unless it’s my lovely captain who does it.
Lars: S-stop it, Sir Claude. I can’t deal with these comments of yours.
Sylvian: I think it’s time to stop teasing Lars. You’re making him uncomfortable.
Lars: That’s right, listen to Master Sylvian.
Claude: …fine, I suppose. Can’t go against out esteemed Captain’s wishes.
Sylvian: Claude, never use someone’s weaknesses as a weapon against them, for it reflects your own character more than theirs.
Claude: Boss Sylvian, as much as I adore your poetry and philosophical quotes, I have to stand my ground when it comes to teasing Captain over here.
Claude: You see, it’s fun for me to see which of his buttons I can push.
Claude: Besides,
Boss
, any person who tries to be good all the time, like you, is bound to come to ruin.
Claude: I would even dare say that you’re the one who is harboring the most dangerous inner feelings among all of us.
Claude: And unless your flowers are the only ones you’re willing to bear your secrets with, it’s about time for your head to equally start fuming like little Rory over here.
Rory: Hmph!
Claude: Not to mention, isn’t it time for you to admit to Lars that you have a crush-
Sylvian: Claude, I treasure you as a guild member of “Custodes Sylvae,” but even still, your mouth resembles that of a snapdragon during moments like this.
Sylvian: A certain amount of grace as the sides of deception press together to bloom in beauty.
Lars: I don’t understand what’s going on here. But can we stop bickering for a second? We’re supposed to support Rory here after all.
Lars: It’s not like you two to argue like this…
Claude: It seems that some things-
Sylvian: are overdue for the both of us.
Rory: That’s right, the show isn’t going to start itself.
Rory: You guys try to gather the kids while I set everything up.
Lars makes his way to where a few groups of kids are gathered and yells an announcement to capture their attention. Yet, Claude and Sylvian make their way towards him as Rory is occupied.
Lars: HEY EVERYONE! I’M BACK! I BROUGHT YOU ALL GIFTS TOO!
Random Kid 1: Yay! Lars is back from his trip.
Random Kid 2: I missed you, Lars; my dragon has been messing with my toys recently. You definitely have to help!
Random Kid 3: Lars! Don’t forget we still have our race for the afternoon. You have to help me win, please!
Lars: Haha this all takes me back to the old days to back when I was a kid.
Sylvian: I hope I’m not bothering you in the middle of your affairs, Lars.
Lars: Of course, not Master, this would be the perfect time to show off my skills to you in person. I’m the fastest amongst everyone here after all.
Claude: Hmm, how typical of our dear captain to compare himself with mere children.
Lars: You could leave for all I care, Sir Claude. I’m still upset because of the way you teased me last time.
Claude: Awe, I’ll pretend to be hurt but while I’m still here, take my advice. You have to challenge yourself more, Captain.

Claude: You won’t be able to show off your talents to anyone when you spend your time with these childish competitions. How will you be able to prove yourself to the elite if you only ever rival with kids?
Lars: Not everything is a contest to prove oneself, Sir Claude.
Lars: Sometimes, I can be content with just playing around and enjoying the moment as is. Isn’t that right, Master?

Sylvian: Success without heart can be empty and hollow, Claude. I treasure you as a guild member of “Custodes Sylvae,” but even still, I worry for the sake of your dependence on wanting to carry yourself differently from your family legacy.
Sylvian: If you merely pursue rivalry to prove your self-worth to unknown faces, it will only be a matter of time, before the present escapes your reach for the past left behind.
Claude: Forgive the insolence,
Boss
. But, isn’t that lack of ambition precisely why you’re here with us today instead of boasting around the academia halls?
Lars: Sir Claude, this is not the right time or place to delve into Master’s past.
Sylvian: Hold on Lar, I want to hear the rest of what Claude has to say.
Lars: If you say so…
Claude: Though I value your presence in our guild and your support of my endeavors
Boss
, you have let go of all your desires and merely follow the direction that your flowery path takes you.
Claude: But, you see, if you’re not determined about what you want, someone else could come and achieve your dream instead.
Claude takes a peek at Lars, as if he was referring to him, and continues talking with Sylvian.
Claude: It’s in the very motto of ‘Custodes Sylvae’ after all.
Claude:
Discere, cogitare, agere
- the triad of wisdom. Learning enriches the mind, and thinking sharpens it, but it is through action that we truly manifest our knowledge and shape our reality.
Claude: You have the first two down but you’re running away from the third step.
Claude: Isn’t that right Captain?
Lars: …
Sylvian: What you’re saying holds grains of truth, Claude.
Sylvian: Without love or ambition, our lives languish in the shadows of mediocrity.
Sylvian: They ignite the fire within, propelling us to venture beyond our limits, to dream and to create, shaping a life of purpose and fulfillment.
Claude: So, you do agree-
Sylvian: However…
Sylvian: Amidst our pursuit of them, let us not overlook the tranquility of mediocrity.
Sylvian: For not every path must lead to grand creations or extraordinary feats.
Sylvian: In embracing simplicity, we find contentment, and in cherishing the ordinary, we discover the beauty of a life unburdened by the pressures of relentless ambition.
Claude: Aren’t you saying that only because you were burnt out and having nothing else to pursue?
Claude: If you always treasured this so-called ‘contentment’ why did you decide to spread your name onto society as the top academic of Zeryph?
Claude: You could have simply stuck to the bottom ranks and let your life aimlessly pass by without ever achieving something or falling in love with a
certain someone
Lars: What’s he talking about, Master? You’re in a relationship with someone?
Claude: Focus here Captain, we can talk about that later. Unless you’ve already taken someone’s side?
Lars: Uhm, you’re both people that I deeply admire and I don’t really want to-
Claude: Don’t? or can’t think up of your personal opinion?
Sylvian: Pay him no mind, he’s just upset for himself.
Lars: It’s not like that…
Lars: … I’m the kind of person who likes to aim for the middle point.
Lars: I think what Master says is true about enjoying what we want instead of simply going after it for the challenge.
Lars: I like hanging out with my dragons even if we weren’t in the middle of an expedition or mission and I wouldn’t change my relationship with them for the world.
Lars: Going after artifact hunts and transporting passengers without an ounce of love seems depressing to me.
Sylvian: Thankfully, Claude’s influence hasn’t rubbed on you too much-
Lars: …But I also agree with what Sir Claude says.
Lars: It’s not fair to not fight for what you love and desire.
Lars: I could admire my dragons all day and night but if I never take that leap of fate to touch them and show them my feelings directly, then I’ll only ever be walking in a circle.
Lars: I also can’t imagine going a day without learning about the new dragon species out there.
Claude: Glad to see that you’ve learnt a few things about my motto of life, Captain. It’s not complete, but I’ll teach more later,
in private
Sylvian: Amidst the circle we tread, like the Ouroboros we find. Forever chasing our tails, destiny intertwined.
Sylvian: I’m always impressed by how well you articulate your words, my dear junior. Maybe, we can discuss these philosophies and more once we have free time.
Lars: Haha, I would love to spend time with the both of you but Spotsy needs me most, don’t you think? She’s had a long flight after all.
Claude: At this rate, I don’t think we’ll ever be able to compete with his love for dragons, Boss.
Sylvian: It’s best if we call a truce for now, it seems?
As the group quietly laugh and joke amongst themselves, Rory enters in a worried state.
Rory: Guys, why isn’t anyone coming, where are the kids?
Lars: Ah, I gathered them all here! As you can…see?
But all that appeared in front of them were unmoving statues. Everyone was shocked.
Rory: Is this a joke? Was there a surprise flash mob that I wasn’t aware of?
Rory: Clauuudy, did you bribe people again to pull a prank on me. If so, then you’re in for a beating-
Claude: As much as I would love to take credit for such an event, I have no clue what’s happening either.
Sylvian: A strange phenomena is happening, it seems.
Sylvian: As if…we’re the only people moving and everyone else is frozen in time.
Lars: What does that mean, Master? What’s going on with everyone?
Lars reaches out to a few of the statue-like figures and starts shaking them.
Lars: Kids, come on, the joke isn’t funny anymore. We’re getting really worried over here.
Claude: What could have suddenly happened here?
Rory: Hold up! Does this have anything to do with the artifact that we just got?
Rory: Are we under a weird spell right now?
Sylvian: I have only ever heard of one artifact having the ability to such a thing. However, the color of the gem in our necklace is different from that I which remember.
Sylvian: Even then, why would such an effect happen so suddenly?
Sylvian: It’s been some time since we contacted the artifact itself.
Claude: I didn’t hear anything about that from my customer either, there was nothing like this when they handed over the artifact to me.
Lars: What do we do now?? What’s going to happen to them?
Sylvian: Steadfast everyone, calm yourselves down.
Sylvian: The brave person is not the one who feels no fear, but the one who conquers that fear. Let’s do our best to figure this out.
Claude: Didn’t accept Boss to take charge like this, color me impressed.
Lars: Me too Master! I’m the strongest one among us, I’ll try to protect us in case something goes south.
Claude: I can try to-
Rory: Guys, wait!
Rory: Can anyone else see that shadowy figure over there?
Claude: I recognize that too little Rory.
Rory: I’m not in the mood for jokes, you scale rotten-
Sylvian: I think we’re being watched by someone.
1.3 – Introduction to Zephyr the Antagonist
Unknown: Well, I think that’s enough standup comedy for today.
Unknown: I was frozen in anticipation for what would come next, but I have work to do after this. My castle isn’t going to clean up itself.
Sylvian: Who’s there? Are you the person behind this? What’s-
Unknown: Slow doooown there
Unknown: Times not running away. Haha, get it?
Sylvian: …
Lars: …
Claude: …
Rory: Heh-
Unknown: DON’T JUDGE ME, OKAY?
Unknown: It’s been some time since I got to speak with someone properly.
Lars: Uhm, why’d you call us human? Can’t you see my tail and -
Unknown: Because that’s what you all obviously are? Duh!

Unknown: All the descendants in this region have been under time suspension for the few months that I’ve been playing around with my artifact and I never had any of them move freely during the process.
Unknown: That’s why…
Unknown: …you must be one of the NEWLY REINCARNATED HUMANS!
Sylvian: …
Lars: …
Claude: …
Rory: Wha-

Unknown: You all must have some special powers that I haven’t seen yet. That’s the only way this makes sense. Otherwise, why would some random descendants suddenly be able to escape my artifact’s influence?
Unknown: Only thing that I can’t make sense of is why you’re dressed up like that?
Unknown: Are you some unique human entertainers?
Unknown: Because even if you reincarnate, you can’t have descendent characteristics. So, you’re probably showmen or something, aren’t you?
Lars: You have quite the deduction skills, don’t you?
Claude: So, you're just random kid messing with a weird spell?
Rory: I think one of his screws is missing.
Sylvian: He’s obviously misunderstanding something; we might be able to use this to our advantage. But before that…
Sylvian: How can you freeze everyone using an artifact? Who exactly are you?
Unknown: It seems that it’s time for the cliché introduction séance, the kind they do for video games and TV shows.
Unknown: Hopefully they had the budget to make me prettier than the rest of you.

Unknown: Anyway, you can address me as the “Omniscient Lord of Bankruptcy” or if it’s easier on the tongue, the “Malevolent Architect of Debt”. I’m actually more of a fan of the second title since it matches my goals more.
Lars: Uhm, does that mean that you cause bankruptcy or that you’re the literal embodiment of bankruptcy?
Rory: Do you design dept plans to bankrupt others or are you so bankrupt that you’re already knee-dip in the debt plan already?
Rory: But then again, I can’t see if you have knees or not. Are you a talking dog by any chance?
Sylvian: I don’t think that’s the issue that we need to be discussing right now-
Malevolent Architect of Debt: Ahhh, keep quiet for a second! I’m not used to this much talking. If it weren’t for you meddling humans, I would have gotten away with my grandiose plan already.
Malevolent Architect of Debt: Hoy! You with the magician outfit! I’ve never seen any of the reincarnated humans escaping from my time freeze.
Malevolent Architect of Debt: You look like the smartest here, aren’t you?
Malevolent Architect of Debt: Might as well spill what’s going on before I decide to do something ominous worthy of my titles.
Claude: Somehow, I really doubt that you’re capable of doing something like that.
Malevolent Architect of Debt: W-w-well, the most I could do right now is brainwash you but you get the idea.
Malevolent Architect of Debt: I could even wipe your minds right now since you’ve already heard my voice, and even learnt of my grandiose plan -though not completely-, and what else…
Malevolent Architect of Debt: …you’re probably going to learn of my real name which is Zephyr but anyway-
Rory: You’re probably not the smartest person, are you? This is the same case of yelling out your attack name before it’s your turn to fight.
Claude: Little Rory, let’s not aggravate him too much now-
Rory: Firstly, don’t test my temper Claauuudy~
Rory: Secondly, why on earth would your parents name you after the country?
Rory: Are you trying to audition for a show somewhere where freak names compete to see whose name they can get wrong the most?
Rory: Well, I’ll let you know that my actual name is S9k#LnM@ which is code for...
Rory: …YOUR MOM.
Zephyr: Is this the humor that descendants use nowadays? Or are you just an … awkward one?
Claude: She’s definitely the weird one. The bar for awkwardness was on the ground, and she brought a shovel to dig up her own grave.
Rory: I'm mentally trying to insult you as much as your existence insults me right now.
Zephyr: Quit trying to shadow my lore explanation with the duo comedy, you two.
Zephyr: I wasn’t named after the
country
Zephyr: The country
was named after
me
Claude: Seem like we have a delusional con-artist here.
Zephyr: I’m not lying!
Claude: Where’s the proof?
Claude: Merchants always need to showcase their credibility, same goes for someone whose exchanging our time with childish bluffs.
Zephyr: Hmph, you can ask any dragon on this land and they’ll testify for me with their blood as the oath.
Sylvian: Are you trying to find loopholes right now? Since everyone’s frozen right now, how are we supposed to bring any of our dragons here. So, are you a liar? Imposter? Fraud-
Rory: A lizard descendent?
Claude: You’re smearing my name here, little Rory.
Rory: How many times do I have to-
Zephyr: I have a few tricks up my sleeve to manually suspend the biological time of the living.
Sylvian: I’m really curious, can you explain for us how that works?
Rory: Come one, Mentor, he can’t actually lack that many braincells now-
Zephyr: I’m glad you asked, Magician! Let me explain to you the details since I haven’t found a proper vassal to talk with in so long.
Rory: No way…
Zephyr: You see, my family has had this unique time freezing artifact for quite a few generations now.

Zephyr: We’d have the responsibility of using it to maintain order and peace in the land as dragon descendants directly influenced by this power. I even have the ability to manually freeze or unfreeze someone when the situation calls for it by directly touching them.
Lars: Uhm, that wouldn’t happen to be the hidden card up your sleeve that you mentioned, right?
Zephyr: …
Zephyr: I-I-I didn’t mention
why
I don’t use it, now did I?
Zephyr: A-Anyways, I’ve decided to use the artifact for my personal gain since the present calls for it. But it’ll all be worth it when my castle is renovated for the arrival of someone
special
Sylvian: Were there never any countermeasure set up in the case of someone misusing the artifact?
Rory: Mentor, shouldn’t we use some discretion here? What if decides to cross us-
Zephyr: If we ever strayed from our path and misused it, it’s couple artifact would counteract the effects of curse. Anyone who touched it, would be immune to the effects of the artifact.
Zephyr: Basically, the same brooch but with a different colored gemstone and the opposite ability-
Sylvian: …Did you say, it was a brooch with a gemstone?
Zephyr: Hmm, yeah, what about it?
Sylvian: Out of curiosity, where is that artifact now?
Zephyr: I’m not an all-knowing encyclopedia now, am I? I-I don’t have any clue as to where it is now…
Sylvian: Come on, we’re listening to your story right now. Might as well, share the ending with us as well.
Sylvian: The ending awaits, a revelation in your voice. Guiding us to contemplate, to make our choice.
Zephyr: I don’t know, I’ve already told you guys so much and I bet you still don’t believe me.
Sylvian: Didn’t you mention the dragons testifying for you? What’s making you lose confidence now?
Zephyr: Because, amidst the certainty of truth, lies have found a sanctuary in the hearts of those who chose to believe, even when confronted with undeniable facts.
Zephyr: I’ve tried to convince so many people till now, humans and descendent alike. What makes your group so special that I shouldn’t instantly freeze right now?
Lars: I can communicate with the dragons, maybe I can test it out?
Everyone turns back to look at Lars for the sudden suggestion.
Lars: Spotsy’s nearby as well, so it wouldn’t be too much trouble to call for her.
Zephyr: Whatever works in my favor, just point to where she is and I’ll wake her up.
Claude: Before that, I have a question to ask of you…
Claude: …What’s stopping you from individually freezing us instead of all this negotiation and story sharing?
Sylvian: There’s obviously something important missing here.
Sylvian: After all, man is not what he thinks he is, he is what he hides.

Zephyr: I-it’s too much of a h-hassle unless it’s a special occasion. It’s not like I have to actually touch you to stimulate the time freeze, and i-it definitely isn’t because I’m bad at physical contact with strangers and that I’m trying to work it out with you guys, okay? OKAY?
Rory: Petition to make this guy our story antagonist, at least we’ll have a 99.9% chance of winning when he spills everything after you nudge him a little.
Zephyr: ANYWAY! Where’s this dragon of yours so I can wake her up?
Lars: She’s a polka dot ruby fireblazer.
Lars: You’ll find her in the open space near the guild’s landing areas. There are lots of flowers that light up the location.
Zephyr: Alright then, stay still, while I’m looking for her. No one move one muscle otherwise I’ll know.
Zephyr takes his leave with Lars’s direction and the group instantly huddles up to discuss their next order of plans.
Rory: What’s going on Mentor? why do we have some random kid trying to play mind tricks on us.
Sylvian: I think we’ll have to believe what he says. His story seems plausible to me, especially what he mentioned about the brooch
Claude: You can’t actually be serious, now? He didn’t even know that we have his so-called counter artifact with us.

Sylvian: I do think that part of his story is dubious, Moreso regarding the disappeared royal family. Our last records of the monarchy of Zephyr are long gone since they’ve been extinct from our history for quite a few millennia.
Lars: Is that why I don’t remember anyone ever mentioning it?
Claude: Not even the archmage of Zephyr mentioned such historical events to me. How did you uncover such a secret, Boss?
Sylvian: …Let’s just say there are many secrets in the academic realm that were being hidden from the masses.
Sylvian: But that’s not what we’re going to discuss right now. Before, our young lord arrives, we need to gather our information.
Sylvian: Lars will you do the honors?
Lars: I’ll try my best, Master.

Lars: We allegedly have one of the missing heirs of the last monarchy on Zephyr suspending time. He claims that he is a dragon descendent and all dragons can testify his claim to his bloodline as a royal. We can see if this is true once he comes back. He’s using a legacy time freeze artifact to freeze everyone, and it’s supposedly identical to the artifact we have. Allegedly, the same brooch with a different gemstone and contrasting ability. He can manually freeze and unfreeze the time for the biological beings he touches but he doesn’t like physical touch with people he doesn’t know. He’s trying to negotiate a deal with us where we won’t trouble his plans of using human zombie armies for his castle renovation.
Lars take a deep breath as if to compensate for all the rambling he just did.
Claude: Wow, didn’t know our Captain could meticulously compile all this info for us. I’m impressed
Sylvian: I trust my juniors’ capabilities.
Lars: Thanks, you two. But one thing, I’m still confused about was his mention of a
special
person. Who could that be?
Sylvian: Looks like we’ll have to save that question for later because our dragon has returned.
They all gaze upwards as the dragon starts landing with Zephyr riding him. He seems quite experienced and manages to reign in Spotsy without any problems.
Zephyr: Here you go, time to prove that my words are right. Chop, chop, hurry!
Lars: Spotsy! I’m so glad to see your safe.
Lars quickly swoops in to hug the dragon even though his size is tiny compared to the gigantic physique of Spotsy.
Lars: Ah, all your wings and scales are in the right place as well!
Zephyr: Of course, they are. I wouldn’t treat someone of the same species with any disrespect.
Lars put his hand on the dragon and starts telepathically talking to her.
Lars (in head): Hey Spotsy, are you doing well right now?
Spotsy (in head): No need to worry, dragon rider Lars.
Spotsy (in head): I have spent centuries asleep in my cocoon, the flow of the essence of time makes of no difference to me.
Lars (in head): I’m glad to hear it. Did Zephyr also bring you up to date about our dilemma?
Spotsy (in head): His royal highness bestowed the honor of guiding me during our short return. As you are aware, dragon rider Lars, us dragon kind have no reason to partake in lies.
Lars (in head): So you’re saying that he’s telling the truth?
Spotsy (in head): His highness has no other choice; it is part of the very règles that makes up our existence. We’d be no different than other descendants or humans if not for these very qualities.
Lars (in head): Is that why he keeps stuttering and blurting out the truth?
Spotsy (in head): That’s because of his highness’s in experience. He was but a young adult once the initial time freeze happened. We all bore witness to it, from millennia left behind
Lars (in head): What’re you talking about, Spotsy?
Lars (in head): He told us he woke up only a few months ago!
Spotsy (in head): All truth will be revealed soon. It’s time for me to fall into the realm of dreams once more.
Lars (in head): Wait Spotsy! I still have to ask-
Zephyr: Time is over, Foxy~ I’ve already refrozen Spotsy over there.
Zephyr: Horrible name choice by the way.
Claude: Hey! It’s because you lack proper etiquette that you can’t understand the meaning behind such a name.
Zephyr: Having more etiquette than a royal family member? That’s quite a bold statement.
Claude: I think the truth has been revealed already, isn’t that right, Lars?
Sylvian: What did our dragon tell you, Lars?
Lars: …
Lars: …he’s been telling us the truth this entire time.
1.4 – Reaching a Compromise
Claude: But the land of Zephyr has been established for millennia!
Sylvian: Though it’s true that we don’t have any records of how the name came to grace our land, how could a royal heir and such an important part of our history be hidden away like this?
Rory: Some things aren’t adding up as much.
Zephyr: All I know is that once I woke up, neither of my parents were home and I was still in the body of a young adult.

Zephyr: You should’ve seen what a wreck my castle had become, and there was no gold either! Many species of descendants have been our faithful servants for the decades that I was awake, however, once I opened my eyes no one was there.
Claude: Is that why you settled on the title of “Omniscient Lord of Bankruptcy”? Then why would you need two titles like “Malevolent Architect of Debt”?
Zephyr: Shh, you can’t cut in while I’m laying down my sob story.
Zephyr: Like I said, I couldn’t find anyone, especially
him
, the castle was completely empty.
Lars: Who are you talking about?
Zephyr: …that’s a story better left for later.
Zephyr: I searched for so many days but I wasn’t getting anywhere.
Zephyr: Eventually I decided to hire some descendants to work for me but they asked for compensation.
Zephyr: But how could I? No money, no family, not even a proper place to sleep in!
Zephyr: They didn’t believe me when I said this realm was named after me either.
Rory: I mean, hardly blame them at this point.
Claude: Long story short, you just wanted free labor.
Claude: We’re past the stage of paying others with exposure and influencer points, you know? Unless it’s me that does it, because they’re getting their gold’s worth and so much more.
Zephyr: Stop cutting in!
Zephyr: Anyway, I realized that a bit too late, the mob of descendants got mad and told me I had to pay them for their efforts so far even if I had to borrow money from loan sharks.
Rory: How much longer is this going to take? Can we skip this?
Rory: Look, the icon is right there in the textbox, I’m sure you can click it quickly. It would be really embarrassing if you couldn’t.
Zephyr: DON’T! PLEASE! I’m reaching the good part of the story after all.
Zephyr: Ahem! So, instead of finding descendants, I decided to hire newly reincarnated humans!
Zephyr: Genuis idea, I know. They wouldn’t have any qualms for compensation since they don’t understand the mechanics of this realm yet.
Zephyr: Bonus points, they also accepted the tale of how I am a royal and that I could gift them positions in my castle as soon as it was renovated.
Zephyr: I need a proper place to rest after all and a castle of that size needs regular maintenance.
Zephyr: Who knows, when
he’s
going to get back either? I need to keep our home clean and well-organized.
Sylvian: You keep mentioning your castle and innocently slaving away unknowing humans, but how does that even result in your usage of an artifact to freeze time?

Claude: That’s right! We’ve been walking around this issue for some time now and we haven’t learnt one single coherent thing from you. Just bits and pieces that aren’t helping us get out of this mess.
Zephyr: I think you’re undermining my generosity here; I gave you so much information for nothing. I could even wipe your brains clean.
Zephyr: After all, I’m only mentioning these because I haven’t had the chance to properly speak with someone for a few weeks now so don’t think that I enjoy banter with humans, okay? OKAY?
Lars: So, let me summarize, you’re a royal descendent whose been sleeping for centuries and BOOM!

Lars: You woke up, broke and homeless. You decided to use free labor from the descendants to clean up the mess in your castle. However, they quickly left since you were knee-deep in debt and couldn’t pay their wages properly. You then decided to slave away unsuspecting humans since they were ignorant about the rules of the realm. Ever since, you’ve been using your time freeze artifact to suspend time. You’ve been using this method to manually capture humans and brainwash them into fixing up your home. Now you’re afraid we could ruin your plans.
Sylvian: The questions that bothers me the most is why you didn’t brainwash the descendants or humans whom you first met and came into contact with?
Claude: You’re obviously lacking a certain moral regard to be paying your employees so poorly and even-
Zephyr: I didn’t want to, okay? But what other choice did I have?
Rory: Literally, anything besides making a house renovating army of human zombie slaves.
Zephyr: I couldn’t win them over with my title and I couldn’t make them work with the loan money either.

Zephyr: The time freeze did help me in relocating them and making sure I was the first one I spoke too so I could make my situation clear but they always found a way to rebel against me once they cahooted with each other.
Zephyr: The mind control was always a last measure for me and even now I’m just left with an army of zombies and eternally doomed to be bored out of my mind.
Claude: Weren’t you the same person who tried to threaten us with brainwashing before you-
Zephyr: It wasn’t like I was bluffing to make you spill what info you had. I’m not that dumb, okay? OKAY?
Sylvian: Fortunately for us, a threatening tongue reveals a wayward start.
Sylvian: For in loose words, a tale unfolds, of inner battles and stories untold.
Sylvian steadied his voice and spoke with an unwavering conviction; he must have a plan in mind.
Sylvian: You lord Zephyr, it’s clear that you’re manipulating a fundamental fabric of time for your mere personal gain.
Sylvian: We can’t remain in this state too long since both physically and mentally, we’re functioning differently than those who are suspended.
Zephyr: Here’s the fact, Swany. I don’t understand the mechanics of it either and we don’t really have to.
Zephyr: Unless you have the counter measure artifact for some bizarre reason and are trying to escape from me.
He
was the last person to have it so it’s probably impossible for you guys.
Lars (in head): That’s literally what we’re trying to do here though! Who is this
he
that the royal descendent keeps mentioning? Ugh, so many unanswered questions…
Lars (in head): …But the most important one is the origins of this artifact. How did Claude manage to get a hold of this? Is this so-called
he
the person that Claude bought the artifact from? Or is it Claude himself?
Lars (in head): But neither of them makes sense, since he is talking about millennia go. Who could it be?
Zephyr: What I’m sure of is that you guys are unique reincarnated humans who are able to move in this limbo.
Lars (in head): But even that assumption is wrong! So, we really have nothing to move forward with.
Zephyr: However, I can’t keep the time frozen forever, since the artifact would heat up.
Zephyr: I can’t leave you guys alone either since you can spoil my plans or come play around with it when I’m not looking especially since I gave you the description for it.
Rory: But that’s your problem, not ours!
Zephyr: Exactly, this is all because I blabbered too much.
Zephyr: That’s why, instead of me giving out all the answers, why don’t you answer some of my questions?
Zephyr: Specifically, why can you move and talk normally right now?
Sylvian: We’re unsure of that as well…
Lars (in head): Is Master trying to lie his way out? But why is he keeping the artifact a secret in the first place?
Zephyr: Then, next question, why are you guys wearing those tails and ears. Are you trying to be cute? Since that plan isn’t working at all.
Rory: Please let me smack him just once, just once…
Sylvian: You could call us human cosplayers.
Sylvian: We prepared these outfits to admire the descendent characteristics and entertain our community.
Lars (in head): Lies again! What’s going on here?
Zephyr: I’ve been surrounded by so many brainwashed humans during the castle renovations that my brain cells are rotting by the lack of creativity and putrid smell of repeated phrases.
Zephyr: Next question, how can I be sure that you won’t be an obstacle until my castle is restored?
Sylvian: …
Claude: …
Rory: We’ll pinky promise
Rory: That’s the most you can get form us.
Zephyr: See? then there’s no reason for me to let you leave-

Lars (in head): This won’t do! I’ll have to understand the truth behind all this for myself. What kind of a dragon pilot would I be if I escape from the very moral règles that makes up the soul of my comrades?
Lars: What if we prove it to you? We’ll find a way to earn your trust.
Zephyr: Somehow, I really doubt that.
Sylvian: Lars! What’re you trying to do?
Lars: You can’t pull that on us, you know? We also gave you a chance when you claimed to be a royal dragon descendent.
Lars: You even woke up Spotsy from her rest to prove your story to us.
Zephyr: …
Lars: You just need to listen to our case.
Zephyr: …
Zephyr: …
Zephyr: Ugh fine! But just for a few minutes. It’s not like I wanted to pay you back for proving me right, okay? OKAY?
Lars: Master Sylvian, you’re the smartest person amongst us-
Claude: I’m hurt but also can’t deny that argument. You should have at least hesitated a bit, Captain.
Lars: We need you to come up with a plan!
Sylvian: Lars, why did you suggest such a thing to him?
Lars: I could ask the same from you, Master! Why do you keep lying to him?
Lars: About how we’re human cosplayers and how we don’t know the reasoning behind this time freeze?
Sylvian: Can you truly not see?
Lars: See what?
Sylvian: I was trying to protect you!
Lars: What…

Sylvian: He’s a dangerous person Lars! Time-freezing? Brainwashing? Ability to act against our countermeasure artifact? He says that he chooses not to do these things but how can you trust him so easily after a few conversations?
Lars: But Spotsy said…

Claude: Sorry, Captain. But I’m siding with Boss on this one. He can be a secret royal heir for all I care, but names only don’t make up for one’s character, I’ve learnt that firsthand as a member of the Dupont family.
Lars: You too, Claude?

Sylvian: You have to understand, Lars. We need to show how powerless we are in front of me so he loses interest. If he gets curious about the origins of the artifact, things will get a difficult turn. He basically admitted to slaving away humas and descendants alike just to have the person withholding our artifact to return.
Sylvian: Is that something that seems sane to you?
Lars: No, but we shouldn’t jump to conclusions either…
Claude: Captain, it’s your naiveté at times like this that will cost us. Listen to us while we still have time, we need to follow Boss’s plan so he loses interest in us.
Lars: …

Lars: … I’m sorry but I can’t do that. I have to trust my gut on this one. If he truly is as dangerous as you guys both thinks, then shouldn’t we try to get to the root of this issue and make sure he doesn’t use the time freeze artifact again?
Zephyr: Hurry up now, I don’t have all day.
Lars marches over to Zephyr while the others protest for his return.
Claude: Captain, you have to stop.
Sylvian: Lars, listen to us.
Rory: Larsy! Wait up for me.
Lars: Royal descendent, we’ll be your private entertainers.
Rory: Larsy, what’re you talking about? We can’t work in cahoots with someone like him!
Zephyr: What’re you trying to scheme human? Are you trying to trick me with this sudden proposal?
Lars: It’s simple, we can’t stay suspended for too long as the effects it could have on our physique and psyche are still unknown to us.
Lars: You won’t let us leave either because we could prove to be an obstacle for you when you decide to constantly check on us and not your army of humans.
Lars: Hence, best we can do is reach a compromise to suit both our interests.
Zephyr: …and your idea of a negotiation is for me to have you all entertain me?
Lars: You like to be entertained, don’t you?
Zephyr: Hmm, such insolence. However, I like to have fun as well. How will you tip the odds to our favor.
Lars: However, you’ll only take me as your entertainer. You need to promise to let the others go.
Zephyr: Wha-

Lars: We’re all human cosplayers as you can see and our time is costly. Others need to keep the guild running, so you have to make due with me. I’m a dragon pilot as well, so we’ll have a lot of things in common.
Lars (in head): Please, take the bait!
Zephyr: …
Zephyr: …two.
Lars: What?
Zephyr: There will be two amongst you who’ll be my human entertainers. I’ll take you to my castle and the rest of you can prance around as it.
Zephyr: You have to keep me entertained well though! I’m a huge fan of confessions and duo comedies. So, keep that in mind as well.
Lars: But that’s not what I told you. It’s only supposed to me.

Zephyr: Hey, Foxy, you didn’t listen to me, it seems. Single confessions are for the holy folk, but for entertainment. How are you going to do a duo comedy with only yourself? Are you going to talk to your reflection in the mirror or your spinless shadow?
Zephyr: So, I give you the option to choose, pick between Swany and Scaly over there since you have the best chemistry with those two.
Lars: …

Sylvian: Lars, I can’t leave you alone like this otherwise I’d lose the place where my heart finds solace and peace. Let us go to his castle together. Your presence is a symphony of joy that resonates within me, and the thought of you leaving feels like abandoning the most enchanting melody. Even though I disagree with this hasty approach, I’ll do my best to assist you with my knowledge and magical prowess.

Claude: Captain, didn’t we talk about our reincarnations plans together? What kind of a duo would we be if one left the other behind? In a world of limitless horizons and uncharted trails, I am a wanderer at heart, forever seeking new thrills and adventures. Yet, amidst the uncertainty that lie ahead, I want you to choose me to walk by your side. I’ll make the journey worthwhile for you with my charm and negotiation techniques.
Thus, the route selection begins.
